parent_formation: No. 243 Wing, No. 212 Group, Desert Air Force
base: LG 172 (Oct-Nov 1942), LG 20 (Nov 1942), LG 101 (Nov 1942), El Adem (Nov 1942), Martuba (Nov-Dec 1942)

sources: Britmodeller forum - 213 Squadron Operation Chocolate discussion
metadata.notes: TIER 4 RESEARCH BRIEF: This extraction is based entirely on Wikipedia and secondary online sources. NO Tier 1 sources (Christopher Shores books, RAF ORBs, National Archives AIR 27 series) or Tier 2 sources (Air Britain, Squadron/Signal, Osprey) were consulted. Commander's full name unknown (only 'Olver' or 'Oliver' found). Personnel numbers are estimates based on typical RAF fighter squadron establishment. Aircraft strength confirmed at 16x Hurricane IIc from multiple sources. Operation Chocolate details partially verified but require primary source corroboration. REQUIRED FOR TIER 2+ UPGRADE: (1) RAF Operations Record Books AIR 27 series for 213 Squadron Oct-Dec 1942, (2) Christopher Shores 'Fighters over the Desert' or 'Mediterranean Air War Vol 2', (3) Official Desert Air Force records for No. 243 Wing composition and operations.
required_sources_for_upgrade: RAF Operations Record Books AIR 27/1389 (or equivalent 213 Squadron ORB reference)
Christopher Shores - Fighters over the Desert (1940-1942) or Mediterranean Air War Vol 2
Air Britain aviation journals covering 213 Squadron 1942
Desert Air Force operational records - No. 243 Wing Oct-Dec 1942
data_gaps: Commander's full first name and initials
Exact personnel breakdown (pilots, ground crew, mechanics, armorers, signals)
Precise aircraft operational status by date
Detailed ordnance stocks and fuel reserves
Complete operations history with sortie counts
Aircraft losses and casualties for Q4 1942
